definition: oil/fat/grease/petroleum/to apply tung oil, paint or varnish/oily/greasy/glib/cunning

sentences.english: This can result in oil starvation and early engine failure .
sentences.chinese: 這會導致設備缺油，發動機會發生早期故障。

sentences.english: SO WORLD markets are short of oil, and supplies of food are running thin.
sentences.chinese: 那麼世界市場可以缺油，而食物供應越來越少。

sentences.english: You are out of gas, so the engine is getting air but no fuel.
sentences.chinese: 你的汽車缺油了，因此引擎吸入空氣，但沒有燃料。

sentences.english: it isn't lacking in oil, though, as dry skin is, but in water.
sentences.chinese: 但它並不像乾性皮膚一樣缺油，而是缺水。

sentences.english: Coal resources are rich while oil resources are deficient in our country, so people have strong desire to develop coal liquefaction technology.
sentences.chinese: 我國富煤缺油，有發展煤炭液化技術的強烈願望。

sentences.english: Cars lined up outside gas stations, and buses running out of fuel stranded many passengers.
sentences.chinese: 一些公共汽車因缺油停運，許多乘客被困在路上。

sentences.english: The engine was starved of petrol and wouldn't start.
sentences.chinese: 發動機缺油，發動不起來。

sentences.english: Consequently, the engine never starves for fuel.
sentences.chinese: 因此發動機不會在這種工況下缺油。

definition: oil spill/oil leak/(fig.) boo! (opposite of 加油[jia1 you2])
to age (of person or object)/becoming old
